adjective.description: (of a subject, state, or activity) demanding careful consideration or application.
Acting or speaking sincerely and in earnest, rather than in a joking or halfhearted manner.
examples: actors who are serious about their work
suddenly he wasn't teasing any more—he was deadly serious

adjective.description: Significant or worrying because of possible danger or risk; not slight or negligible.
examples: Haydn was Mozart's only serious rival

adjective.description: Substantial in terms of size, number, or quality.
examples: he suddenly had serious money to spend

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French serieux or late Latin seriosus, from Latin serius earnest, serious.
